column5: What knot would you guys say is the strongest and easy to tie? Im doing this knot where you make a loop and then wrap around the loop six times sorry if this doesn't make any sense but ye its a good knot but i was wondering if there are any better suggestions? Thanks -Little Angler
I always use the Palomar knot. Google it and try to learn it, it is not to hard at all.
Here is a site with different knots used while fishing ...  http://www.animatedknots.com/indexfishing.php  I like the palomar knot.
I've tried'em all but this one is my favorite.  <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="
hands down the best knot
Palomar
Anybody every try the Bucher power knot?  It looks like an improved palomar knot.  Though it's a bit more difficult to tie, maybe it's better.  I haven't used it yet but it's on my "to do" list.
I use the uni knot and find it very strong..... Here is a link to an animated knot site  http://www.animatedknots.com/uniknot/index...imatedknots.com  Leechman
Great instructional video, Roy.  That pretty much explains it all.
Im a big fan of the trilene knot.  Use it all the time except if i am making my own spinner rigs, or salmon flies.  I am going to try the rapala knot though...i like that idea
Another for the Palomar.
i've been using the clinch knot since i can remember..  gonna try using that palomar knot for a lil while though
Palamar is the way to go.....really strong knot and easy to learn
Polomar all the way!!!
I just started using the trilene knot this year, and it took me 5 minutes to learn and has not broken yet.
I like the Trilene knot for mono, palomar for braid.
Palomar is easy to tie and maintains strength at the knot - what else do you need?
ahahahaha, thats my fav now .
without out a shadow of a doubt the pal........... uni knot, most versatile knot out there.

The Palomar comes out as the strongest out there, based on every test I've seen, but personally, I find it a PITA to tie.  I've been using the Trilene knot for years, and stick to it most of the time.
Palomar, uni..trilene are all great knots.  I find that the Polamar is the easiest to tie.  Uni to Uni is great to know for leaders...
Anything with a leader I like to snell my hooks.  Mono, I like the improved cinch knot and with braided line I go to the polymar knot.
